channel.title: Trouble With Login
channel.description:
Wasn't quite sure whether to put this is Server Help or Client Help but I'm assuming it would go in server help.
So, When I try to log in on the server command line it says this [code][19/04/15 2:28 AM]: Ydamoiscool: character file not found. [19/04/15 2:28 AM]: [Logged in]: Ydamoiscool[/code]
For some reason it puts a Y before the name, not sure why i checked through the a lot of the server files and some of the client files but I couldn't find anything.
On the Client command line it gives the following error and immediately goes back to the login screen but it doesn't log me out. Any ideas on this? Never encountered this before. [code]Error: T1 - 192,0 - -1,-1[/code]

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

matzie:

T1 error is unknown packet [S->C]. Are you use you are using the same revision on your client/sever pair?

Correct… That’s why I believe it’s an error with the server reading the data the client is sending… And is also why I asked him to trace the playerName each time it’s modified or sent.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

T1 error is unknown packet [S->C]. Are you use you are using the same revision on your client/sever pair?

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

Alright I’ll try that. I put it to where you click login and its all fine there. I’ll try some other places. Just about ready to give up though.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It could be a numerous of things. The name could be getting sent with a y in front of it. The server could be adding a y. The data may be sent incorrectly so it’s adding the y. it could be getting read incorrectly and adding the y.

The only way to know?
Debugging.

Add some trace statements (like this: System.out.println("Playername before trim: " + playerName) ) to the code. Both client and server sided.

Add it where the username is getting sent from the client to the server, where the server first reads it, and anywhere the server may modify the username upon logging in.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

It could be client sided. Check where your username is sent to the server in your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

The only other place its being called is RS2LoginProtocol.java

if (returnCode == 2) { int load = PlayerSave.loadGame(cl, cl.playerName, cl.playerPass);

Forgot to mention, had to remove this from RS2LoginProtocol.java because it wouldn’t let me login

if((rsaBuffer.readByte() & 0xff) != 10) { System.out.println("Encrypted id != 10."); channel.close(); return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble With Login
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Damoiscool, post:3, topic:551148”]Gotta be somewhere else its not there.
[im]http://oi62.tinypic.com/2enp2d2.jpg[/im]

Just realised theres also this error in the client. would it have anything to do with it?

java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 401 for URL: https://dl .dropboxusercontent.com/s/wgvn5dyzrhefl3q/Project%20Raw%20BETA.jar at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream0(Unknown S ource) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(Unkn own Source)[/quote]

Look for where the loadgame method is being called throughout the entire server. Find where it’s adding a Y before the player name.
Client’s error is irrelevant to this problem.

Read full topic

PlayerSave class says this

Look where loadGame is calling Y + playerName.
